Hi Dave,



I have been running the opposed flow code from Python and have an interest
in extracting some additional information to calculate mixture fraction and
local scalar dissipation rate.  I could do it in Excel, but I thought I
could just do some of the calculations in Python and add a column for
mixture fraction to the csv file that is written.  Seems like I should be
able to call out something like the mass fraction for a particular element,
or the number of hydrogen atoms that that species has, etc.

I haven't been able to figure out the nuances of syntax for the gas object,
or how python should tease them out.  (I have figured out things like
gas.meanMolecularWeight () , and getting the full list of Species Names,
etc.)



If you have a few minutes, could you give me a quick and dirty on the
structure of the gas object?  (Or maybe send me a reference to the correct
header file that could clear it up).



Many thanks,



Houston Miller
